Package model

Class Dependable<V>

java.lang.Object
model.Dependable<V>
Type Parameters:
V - The encapsulated type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.beans.InvalidationListener, javafx.beans.Observable, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseQuery.BQResultSet, BaseQuery.BQResultSetMetaData, BaseQuery.BQRowsList, BaseQuery.BQStatement, TableQuery.TQSQLQuery
public abstract class Dependable<V> extends Object implements javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<V>, javafx.beans.InvalidationListener
This class standardizes a way to push updates forward through a chain of Observables and InvalidationListeners.
A Dependable has some number of Dependencies (Observables). When one of those Dependencies are invalidated, the Dependable gets notified that it needs to re-run its InnerConstruct(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, ?>) method to ensure the value it encapsulates is dependable. Having re-run itself, a Dependable will inform its listeners, so they can update themselves.

    • Dependable

      public Dependable(Map<String,? extends javafx.beans.Observable> initialDependencies)
      This method constructs a Dependable with the given dependencies, accessible by their String keys. This constructor uses a Lambda to map listening to the initial dependencies.
      Parameters:
      initialDependencies -

    • InnerValidate

      protected abstract boolean InnerValidate() throws Throwable
      This method is run to check whether this Dependable is ready and usable, or if its contents need to be reconstructed.
      Returns:
      Whether the encapsulated value needs reconstructed.
      Throws:
      Throwable - Any errors encountered.

    • InnerConstruct

      protected abstract V InnerConstruct(Map<String,?> depValues) throws Throwable
      This method reconstructs the encapsulated value. Crucially, this method is not passed the Observable dependencies, but their values if they have values, otherwise the dependencies themselves.
      Parameters:
      depValues - A map from Strings to the value of dependencies, allowing for easy access.
      Returns:
      The new encapsulated value.
      Throws:
      Throwable - Catch-all for any errors during reconstruction.

    • constantDependable

      public static <C> Dependable<C> constantDependable(C constant)
      This static method constructs a Dependable which never needs to re-evaluate, and always returns exactly what was given.
      Type Parameters:
      C - The type of the value to always return
      Parameters:
      constant - The value to always return.
      Returns:
      A Dependable which will always return the Constant it was given.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This method packs all the current status of this Dependable into a string for debugging.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:

    • pushToListeners

      private void pushToListeners(V oldValue, V newValue)
      This method informs listeners that this Dependable has updated. This is accomplished by mapping a lambda over each type of listener.
      Parameters:
      oldValue - The prior value the Dependable encapsulated (Unreliable due to update-in-place Observables)
      newValue - The newly updated value the Dependable encapsulates (Reliable)

    • invalidated

      private void invalidated(Map<String,?> depValues)
      This method gets called internally to handle rebuilding the encapsulated value and pushing updates to listeners.
      Parameters:
      depValues -

      public void invalidated()
      This method is called by some anonymous source of change to instruct this Dependable to refresh.

    • invalidated

      public void invalidated(javafx.beans.Observable o)
      This method is called with some Observable to instruct this Dependable to refresh.
      Specified by:
      invalidated in interface javafx.beans.InvalidationListener

    • getDepValues

      private Map<String,?> getDepValues()
      This method transforms the Map of Strings to dependencies, into a map of Strings to the values of those dependencies.
      Returns:
      A map of dependency names, and the values within those dependencies.

    • getValue

      public V getValue()
      This method checks to make sure the Dependable has a valid and up-to-date encapsulated value (including checking all its dependencies), then returns that up-to-date encapsulated value.
      Specified by:
      getValue in interface javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<V>
